title: Fix tip avatar not matching
body:

Thank you for your pull request! Please review the requirements below, read through the contributor's guide, 
and ensure your pull request has fulfilled all requirements outlined by the Gitcoin Core team.
Have you read the contributors guide?: https://docs.gitcoin.co/mk_contributors/

##### Description

<!-- Describe your changes here. -->
This use the same avatar as profiles when tipping a user by searching or linking from profiles 
Also fix the logic to pick the active avatar of the user to match the profile instead of the first one on the query results.
Example:
Is very confusing when you search some user to tip and the picture doesn't match with the one on profile, that make you feel insecure.

title: Add Sablier Tip Streaming
body:
# Description 
This PR adds support for Sablier Streaming to Gitcoin Tips which can be done through gitcoin.co/tips

# Work Done - 
 [x]  Has to work on mobile
 [x]  Has to work on `gitcoin.co`, `pay.sablier.finance` and `app.sablier.finance` as well, therefore you have to create the stream through the Payroll.sol proxy
 [ ]  If no address is on file for a profile, then no stream can be done, but the user can send an invite email to that user asking them what their eth address is

# Work Accomplished by this PR -

1. The stream can now be created from the Tips Page.
2. After the stream is created, the details are updated in the gitcoin backend.
3. Because of that the stream details (Stream Link) is sent to the User Notifications, Email as well as it is updated to Gitcoin Activity.

# Future Work to be done -
1. Add support for better backend to update Sablier Tip Link when the stream is created.
2. Use `CREATE2` features to create a stream when a user does not have any account so it can be redeem later

Few Screenshots of the whole process :- https://imgur.com/a/irdbnUn

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0
GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

title: Add support for tipping using Sablier
body:
<!-- 
Thank you for your pull request! Please review the requirements below, read through the contributor's guide, 
and ensure your pull request has fulfilled all requirements outlined by the Gitcoin Core team.
Have you read the contributors guide?: https://docs.gitcoin.co/mk_contributors/ 
-->

##### Description

<!-- Describe your changes here. -->

This PR is part of the Sustain Web3 hackathon. It adds a toggle to existing gitcoin.co/tip flow to allow users to toggle between legacy tips and stream tips using Sablier

##### What it solves so far:

- [X] Has to work on mobile
- [X] Has to work on `gitcoin.co`, `pay.sablier.finance` and `app.sablier.finance` as well, therefore you have to create the stream through the Payroll.sol proxy
- [X] If no address is on file for a profile, then no stream can be done, but the user can send an invite email to that user asking them what their eth address is

##### TODO/Features that should be implemented in the future:

- Validate CompoundTokens
- Update the `Tip` table schema to add some metadata about the streaming when calling methods `tip/send/3` or `tip/send/4`
- Update metadata on email sent when tip is created so recipient receives an URL (`app.sablier.finance/stream/XX`) where he can redeem the streamed tip. Right now, this URL is specified through the UI after the stream is created
- Use `CREATE2` features to create a stream when a user does not have any account so it can be redeem later

##### Video Demo

[Watch it here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lA8SKTG1Qfo&feature=youtu.be)

##### Other Remakrs

This code was tested on the Rinkeby testnet. Take into account the following steps when testing this implementation:

- Go to the [admin](https://docs.gitcoin.co/mk_setup/#add-a-custom-erc20-token-to-your-local-gitcoin) console and update the DAI token address on Rinkeby to `0xc3dbf84abb494ce5199d5d4d815b10ec29529ff8` 
- Mint yourself some TestnetDAI using [etherscan](https://rinkeby.etherscan.io/token/0xc3dbf84abb494ce5199d5d4d815b10ec29529ff8)
- Follow the [official docs](https://docs.gitcoin.co/mk_third_party_integrations/#setup-sendgrid-to-send-emails-recommended) to config `SendGrid` and enable sending emails in your local Gitcoin deployment

##### Refers/Fixes

<!-- If this PR is related to a Github issue, please add a link here. -->
Refs: https://github.com/gitcoinco/web/issues/5914

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0
GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

title: Bump django from 2.2.4 to 2.2.10 in /requirements
body:
Bumps [django](https://github.com/django/django) from 2.2.4 to 2.2.10.
Commits - [`b2c33a5`](https://github.com/django/django/commit/b2c33a57b3b98f1e90bbc2a2be2c5a6d814eed29) [2.2.x] Bumped version for 2.2.10 release. - [`c67a368`](https://github.com/django/django/commit/c67a368c16e4680b324b4f385398d638db4d8147) [2.2.x] Fixed CVE-2020-7471 -- Properly escaped StringAgg(delimiter) parameter. - [`96d6443`](https://github.com/django/django/commit/96d644312106337d714790cbedfcb227f0faa609) [2.2.x] Fixed timezones tests for PyYAML 5.3+. - [`813b33e`](https://github.com/django/django/commit/813b33eec4d3fef8c5c3d4bfbc6ac90a248680c6) [2.2.x] Added CVE-2019-19844 to the security archive. - [`e728612`](https://github.com/django/django/commit/e7286122b42d863bc1e97a846330cc63303f1c21) [2.2.x] Post-release version bump. - [`c494d90`](https://github.com/django/django/commit/c494d90c195a739a7298b073eaa6ed987c2fd0bc) [2.2.x] Bumped version for 2.2.9 release. - [`4d334be`](https://github.com/django/django/commit/4d334bea06cac63dc1272abcec545b85136cca0e) [2.2.x] Fixed CVE-2019-19844 -- Used verified user email for password reset r... - [`86befcc`](https://github.com/django/django/commit/86befcc172c23170a720b3e0c06db51a99b3da59) [2.2.x] Refs [#31073](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/django/django/issues/31073) -- Added release notes for 02eff7ef60466da108b1a33f1e4dc0... - [`f33be1e`](https://github.com/django/django/commit/f33be1e8ae2efbca5f209e2365fa35c2aaee340c) [2.2.x] Fixed [#31073](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/django/django/issues/31073) -- Prevented CheckboxInput.get_context() from mutating a... - [`e8b0903`](https://github.com/django/django/commit/e8b0903976077b951795938b260211214ed7fe41) [2.2.x] Fixed [#31006](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/django/django/issues/31006) -- Doc'd backslash escaping in date/time template filters. - Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/django/django/compare/2.2.4...2.2.10)

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=django&package-manager=pip&previous-version=2.2.4&new-version=2.2.10)](https://help.github.com/articles/configuring-automated-security-fixes) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot use these labels` will set the current labels as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these reviewers` will set the current reviewers as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these assignees` will set the current assignees as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use this milestone` will set the current milestone as the default for future PRs for this repo and language You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/gitcoinco/web/network/alerts).

title: mini CLR rounds on newsfeed - READY FOR REVIEW
body: ##### Description This is what this looks like: The bones are done done: - [X] mechanisms to create /schedule match rounds - [X] mechanisms to continually refresh match rankings - [X] mechanism to automatically make a CLR payout - [X] mechanism to follow users straight on newsfeed Still gotta put the finishing touches on here: - [x] show CLR estimates on newsfeed items (not just leaderboard) - [x] make estimates refresh when new tip is made (either ajax or fresh) - [x] make tips non alpha - [ ] a TLDR how it works module (need help from design) - [ ] what do we do with the follow data? do we highlight it into the various tab types? - [x] follow buttons everywhere on newsfeed - [x] create Earnings, newsfeed items, email when payout happys. celebrate it! ##### Refers/Fixes https://github.com/gitcoinco/web/issues/5941 ##### Testing tested locally should be merged along with https://github.com/gitcoinco/web/pull/5916/

2. Shows tribes stats on the follow button

title: One-on-one help on Gitcoin
body:
<!-- 
Thank you for your pull request! Please review the requirements below, read through the contributor's guide, 
and ensure your pull request has fulfilled all requirements outlined by the Gitcoin Core team.
Have you read the contributors guide?: https://docs.gitcoin.co/mk_contributors/ 
-->

##### Description

<!-- Describe your changes here. -->
Add a new page in the Gitcoin website that embeds a video call and uses the Sablier protocol for the real-time finance part. The mentee streams money to the mentor while they are on the call.

Team members: @lcoenen @zoek1
##### Refers/Fixes

<!-- If this PR is related to a Github issue, please add a link here. -->

#5727 

##### Testing
1. Create a session
2. invite to one user sharing the url link or wait to someone join the session from the mentor panel
  - The mentee will be requested to deposit the DAI, this takes a while due to waiting the tx confirmation
3. A video session will be started from there screen, the mentee could stop the stream, the mentor could withdraw the funds.
4. Once the stream stopped, the session is finished and the users will be available to join or create other session.

See demo: https://youtu.be/IxD9zHaqPJs
[![IMAGE ALT TEXT HERE](https://img.youtube.com/vi/IxD9zHaqPJs/0.jpg)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IxD9zHaqPJs)

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

title: [WIP] - One-on-One Help for Gitcoin with Sablier Money Streaming
body:
Adding a "mentoring" feature to Gitcoin with the ability to stream money using Sablier's Protocol contract. With money streaming as a feature alone, this should be greater than what Codementor provides (opinion).

This is a work in progress. I will be updating this description with further detail and explanations. For now, refer to https://github.com/gitcoinco/web/issues/5727#issuecomment-573280534 and commit messages -I attempt to document and note my thoughts at a given snapshot in time.

- Gitmentor Demo: Incomplete Request Form with Money Streaming: https://youtu.be/gK8xPIm9tMk

title: Use blockscout to find valid payouts
body:
<!-- 
Thank you for your pull request! Please review the requirements below, read through the contributor's guide, 
and ensure your pull request has fulfilled all requirements outlined by the Gitcoin Core team.
Have you read the contributors guide?: https://docs.gitcoin.co/mk_contributors/ 
-->

##### Description

This PR adds a utility function to check to see if a payout tx has been made for ETC using blockscout. It also adds a payout_tx_id to the bounty model to track previous payouts.

##### Refers/Fixes

https://github.com/gitcoinco/web/issues/5561

##### Testing

untested

title: [3Box Integration] Add 'Upload to 3Box' button to Avatar Builder
body:
<!-- 
Thank you for your pull request! Please review the requirements below, read through the contributor's guide, 
and ensure your pull request has fulfilled all requirements outlined by the Gitcoin Core team.
Have you read the contributors guide?: https://docs.gitcoin.co/mk_contributors/ 
-->

##### Description

<!-- Describe your changes here. -->

Based on the feature requested for https://github.com/3box/3box/issues/839, implement the GitCoin-3Box integration feature for Avatar Builder per the request of Kevin (@owocki). 

We will take advantage of what we have achieved in GitCoin and 3Box integration in https://github.com/gitcoinco/web/pull/5640, and extend the backup functionalities to Avatar Builder.

The design doc for this feature can be found here: https://hackmd.io/@L9ZnGph8Tbaio2GVX_z-EA/SylymWCAr


##### Refers/Fixes

<!-- If this PR is related to a Github issue, please add a link here. -->

https://github.com/gitcoinco/web/issues/5660

##### Testing

<!-- All PRs should be accompanied by tests! If you haven't added tests, please explain here. -->

Preview for this feature can be found below:

1. "upload to 3box" button

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46699230/71375357-ed34d080-25f8-11ea-9aa1-5f0b23665c4b.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46699230/71375342-dbebc400-25f8-11ea-801a-23ce4e8cebad.png)


2. Verify the uploaded custom avatar data in 3Box Hub

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46699230/71374966-a4c8e300-25f7-11ea-824b-c01f81e243d7.png)

(looks a bit messy due to the 3Box Hub UI)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46699230/71375005-bf02c100-25f7-11ea-8157-7f773ed8ed93.png)
